org.hps.readout

Class DigitizationReadoutDriver<D extends Subdetector>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.readout.DigitizationReadoutDriver<D>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcalDigitizationReadoutDriver, HodoscopeDigitizationReadoutDriver

    public abstract class DigitizationReadoutDriver<D extends Subdetector>
extends ReadoutDriver
    Class DigitizationReadoutDriver performs digitization of truth hits from SLIC by converting them into emulated pulses and then performing pulse integration. The results are output in the form of RawCalorimeterHit objects.

    The truth hit information is retained by also producing an output collection of LCRelation objects linking the raw hits to the original SimCalorimeterHit objects from which they were generated.

    DigitizationReadoutDriver is itself abstract. It is designed with the intent to function for both the hodoscope and the calorimeter. As such, it requires its implementing classes to handle certain subdetector-specific tasks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DigitizationReadoutDriver.PulseShape
      Enumerable PulseShape defines the allowed types of pulses that may be used to emulate the subdetector response to incident energy.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.lcsim.util.Driver

        Driver.AbortRunException, Driver.NextEventException

    • Field Detail

      • geometryName

        private String geometryName
        Specifies the name of the subdetector geometry object.

      • truthHitCollectionName

        private String truthHitCollectionName
        The name of the input SimCalorimeterHit truth hit collection from SLIC.

      • outputHitCollectionName

        private String outputHitCollectionName
        The name of the digitized output RawCalorimeterHit collection.

      • truthRelationsCollectionName

        private String truthRelationsCollectionName
        The name of the LCRelation collection that links output raw hits to the SLIC truth hits from which they were generated.

      • triggerTruthRelationsCollectionName

        private String triggerTruthRelationsCollectionName
        The name of the LCRelation collection that links output raw hits to the SLIC truth hits from which they were generated. This collection is output for trigger path hits, and is never persisted.

      • readoutCollectionName

        private String readoutCollectionName
        The name of the collection which contains readout hits. The class type of this collection will vary based on which mode the simulation is set to emulate.

      • addNoise

        private boolean addNoise
        Indicates whether or not noise should be simulated when converting truth energy depositions to the voltage amplitudes.

      • pePerMeV

        private double pePerMeV
        Defines the number of photoelectrons per MeV of truth energy for the purpose of noise calculation.

      • fixedGain

        private double fixedGain
        Defines a fixed gain to be used for all subdetector channels. A negative value will result in gains being pulled from the conditions database for the run instead. Units are in MeV/ADC.

      • pulseShape

        private DigitizationReadoutDriver.PulseShape pulseShape
        Defines the pulse shape to use when simulating detector truth energy deposition response.

      • tp

        private double tp
        Defines the pulse time parameter. This influences the shape of a pulse generated from truth energy depositions and will vary depending on the form of pulse selected. Units are in ns.

      • integrationThreshold

        protected int integrationThreshold
        Defines the ADC threshold needed to initiate pulse integration for raw hit creation.

      • numSamplesBefore

        protected int numSamplesBefore
        Defines the number of integration samples that should be included in the pulse integral from before the sample that exceeds the integration threshold.

      • numSamplesAfter

        protected int numSamplesAfter
        Defines the number of integration samples that should be included in the pulse integral from after the sample that exceeds the integration threshold. Threshold-crossing sample is part of NSA.

      • mode

        private int mode
        The format in which readout hits should be output.

      • writeTriggerTruth

        private boolean writeTriggerTruth
        Specifies whether trigger path hit truth information should be included in the driver output.

      • writeTruth

        private boolean writeTruth
        Specifies whether readout path truth information should be included in the driver output.

      • READOUT_PERIOD

        private static final double READOUT_PERIOD
        Defines the length in nanoseconds of a hardware sample.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • readoutCounter

        private int readoutCounter
        Serves as an internal clock variable for the driver. This is used to track the number of clock-cycles (1 per READOUT_PERIOD).

      • voltageBufferMap

        private Map<Long,DoubleRingBuffer> voltageBufferMap
        A buffer for storing pulse amplitudes representing the signals from the preamplifiers. These are stored in units of Volts with no pedestal. One buffer exists for each subdetector channel.

      • truthBufferMap

        private Map<Long,ObjectRingBuffer<SimCalorimeterHit>> truthBufferMap
        Buffers the truth information for each sample period so that truth relations can be retained upon readout.

      • adcBufferMap

        private Map<Long,IntegerRingBuffer> adcBufferMap
        A buffer for storing ADC values representing the converted voltage values from the voltage buffers. These are stored in units of ADC and include a pedestal. One buffer exists for each subdetector channel.

      • geometry

        private D extends Subdetector geometry
        Stores the subdetector geometry object.

      • channelIntegrationSumMap

        private Map<Long,Integer> channelIntegrationSumMap
        Stores the total ADC sums for each subdetector channel that is currently undergoing integration.

      • channelIntegrationTruthMap

        private Map<Long,Set<SimCalorimeterHit>> channelIntegrationTruthMap
        Stores the total ADC sums for each subdetector channel that is currently undergoing integration.

      • channelIntegrationTimeMap

        private Map<Long,Integer> channelIntegrationTimeMap
        Stores the time at which integration began on a given channel. This is used to track when the integration period has ended.

      • channelIntegrationADCMap

        private Map<Long,List<Integer>> channelIntegrationADCMap

      • localTimeOffset

        private double localTimeOffset
        Defines the time offset of objects produced by this driver from the actual true time that they should appear.

      • CHANNEL_INTEGRATION_DEADTIME

        private static final int CHANNEL_INTEGRATION_DEADTIME
        Stores the minimum length of that must pass before a new hit may be integrated on a given channel. Unit: clock-cycle
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • readoutWindow

        protected int readoutWindow
        Defines the total time range around the trigger time in which hits are output into the readout LCIO file. The trigger time position within this range is determined by readoutOffset.

      • readoutOffset

        private int readoutOffset
        Sets how far from the beginning of the readout window trigger time should occur. A value of x, for instance would result in a window that starts at triggerTime - x and extends for a total time readoutWindow.

      • mode13HitCollectionParams

        private LCIOCollection<RawTrackerHit> mode13HitCollectionParams
        Defines the LCSim collection data for the trigger hits that are produced by this driver when it is emulating Mode-1 or Mode-3.

      • mode7HitCollectionParams

        private LCIOCollection<RawCalorimeterHit> mode7HitCollectionParams
        Defines the LCSim collection data for the trigger hits that are produced by this driver when it is emulating Mode-7.

      • truthRelationsCollectionParams

        private LCIOCollection<LCRelation> truthRelationsCollectionParams
        Defines the LCSim collection data that links SLIC truth hits to the their corresponding simulated output hit.

      • flagStartNewIntegration

        private Map<Long,Boolean> flagStartNewIntegration
        Flag to point out that new integration could be started at a sample between CHANNEL_INTEGRATION_DEADTIME and numSamplesAfter for the case is less than numSamplesAfter

      • integrationTime

        private double integrationTime
        Since new integration could happen between CHANNEL_INTEGRATION_DEADTIME and numSamplesAfter, integration time needs to be assigned as parameter of ReadoutDataManager.addData(). Global displacement is 0 for dependency.

        private static final int BUFFER_LENGTH
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        private static final int PIPELINE_LENGTH
        See Also:

      • getTimeDisplacement

      • cloneHitToTime

        private static final CalorimeterHit cloneHitToTime(CalorimeterHit hit,
                                                   double newTime)
        Clones an object of type CalorimeterHit and returns a copy that is shifted in time by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to clone.
        newTime - - The new time for the hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a time-shifted hit as an object of type CalorimeterHit, unless the input hit was a SimCalorimeterHit object, in which case the truth information will be retained.

      • getTriggerADCValues

        private short[] getTriggerADCValues(long cellID,
                                    double triggerTime)
        Gets the ADC values for the trigger readout window for the requested cell ID and returns them as a short primitive array.
        Parameters:
        cellID - - The ID for the channel of the requested ADC value array.
        triggerTime - - The time of the trigger to be written.
        Returns:
        Returns the ADC values in a time range equal to the readout window positioned around the trigger time as array of short primitives.

      • getTriggerTruthValues

                                                            double triggerTime)

        Parameters:
        cellID - - The channel ID.
        triggerTime - - The trigger time.
        Returns:
        Returns all truth hits that occurred within the ADC readout window around the trigger time for the specified channel.

      • pulseAmplitude

        private double pulseAmplitude(double time,
                              long cellID)
        Returns pulse amplitude at the given time (relative to hit time). Gain is applied.
        Parameters:
        time - Units of ns. Relative to hit time (negative=before the start of the pulse).
        cellID - Crystal ID as returned by hit.getCellID().
        Returns:
        Amplitude, units of volts/GeV.

      • pulseAmplitude

        private static final double pulseAmplitude(double time,
                                           DigitizationReadoutDriver.PulseShape shape,
                                           double shapingTime)
        Calculates the amplitude of a pulse at the given time, where the time is relative to the hit time, and for a given pulse shape.
        Parameters:
        time - - The time in the pulse. This is in units of ns and is relative to the hit time. A negative value represents the pulse shape before the hit occurs.
        shape - - The type of pulse for which the calculation is to be performed.
        shapingTime - - A fitting parameter that influences the shape of the pulse.
        Returns:
        Returns the pulse amplitude in units of inverse ns. The amplitude is normalized so that the pulse integral is one.

      • readoutTime

        private double readoutTime()
        Gets the local time for this driver.
        Returns:
        Returns the local time for this driver.

      • resetBuffers

        private void resetBuffers()
        Resets the driver buffers to their default values.

      • setAddNoise

        public void setAddNoise(boolean state)
        Sets whether randomized noise should be added to SLIC truth energy depositions when simulating subdetector hits. This is true by default.
        Parameters:
        state - - true means that noise will be added and false that it will not.

      • setGeometryName

        public void setGeometryName(String value)
        Defines the name of the subdetector geometry object.
        Parameters:
        ecalName - - The subdetector name.

      • setFixedGain

        public void setFixedGain(double value)
        Sets a single uniform value for the gain on all channels. This will override the conditions database value. If set negative, the conditions database values will be used instead. Gains are defined in units of MeV/ADC. This defaults to -1.
        Parameters:
        value - - The uniform gain to be employed across all channels in units of MeV/ADC. A negative value indicates to use the conditions database values.

      • setIntegrationThreshold

        public void setIntegrationThreshold(int value)
        Sets the threshold that a pulse sample must exceed before pulse integration may commence. Units are in ADC and the default value is 12 ADC.
        Parameters:
        value - - The pulse integration threshold, in units of ADC.

      • setInputHitCollectionName

        public void setInputHitCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the input truth his collection name.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int value)
        Sets the operational mode of the simulation. This affects the form of the readout hit output. Mode may be set to the values 1, 3, or 7.
        Parameters:
        value - - The operational mode.

      • setNumberSamplesAfter

        public void setNumberSamplesAfter(int value)
        Defines the number of samples from after a threshold-crossing pulse sample that should be included in the pulse integral. Units are in clock-cycles (4 ns samples) and the default value is 20 samples.
        Parameters:
        value - - The number of samples.

      • setNumberSamplesBefore

        public void setNumberSamplesBefore(int value)
        Defines the number of samples from before a threshold-crossing pulse sample that should be included in the pulse integral. Units are in clock-cycles (4 ns samples) and the default value is 5 samples.
        Parameters:
        value - - The number of samples.

      • setOutputHitCollectionName

        public void setOutputHitCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the hits produced by this driver for use in the trigger simulation.

        Note that this is not the name of the collection output when a trigger occurs. For this value, see the method setReadoutHitCollectionName(String) instead.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setPersistent

        public void setPersistent(boolean state)
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Sets whether this data collection should be written to the output LCIO file.
        Overrides:
        setPersistent in class ReadoutDriver
        Parameters:
        state - - true means that the collection is persisted, and false that it is not.

      • setPhotoelectronsPerMeV

        public void setPhotoelectronsPerMeV(double value)
        Sets the number of photoelectrons per MeV of deposited energy. This value is used in the simulation of subdetector hit noise due to photoelectron statistics.
        Parameters:
        value - - The number of photoelectrons per MeV.

      • setPulseShape

        public void setPulseShape(String pulseShape)
        Sets the pulse-shape model used to simulate pre-amplifier pulses. The default value is ThreePole.
        Parameters:
        pulseShape - - The name of the pulse shape model that is to be employed. Valid options are ThreePole, DoubleGaussian, or CRRC.

      • setPulseTimeParameter

        public void setPulseTimeParameter(double value)
        Sets the shaper time parameter for pulse simulation. The value depends on the pulse shape selected. For the default pulse shape ThreePole, it is equal to the RC, or half the peaking time (9.6 ns).
        Parameters:
        value - The pulse time parameter in units of nanoseconds.

      • setReadoutHitCollectionName

        public void setReadoutHitCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the triggered hit output collection. This collection will hold all hits produced when a trigger occurs.

        Note that this collection is different from the hits produced for internal usage by the readout simulation. For this value, see the method setOutputHitCollectionName(String) instead.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setReadoutOffset

        public void setReadoutOffset(int value)
        Sets the number of samples by which readout hit pulse-crossing samples should be offset. Units are in clock-cycles (intervals of 4 ns).
        Parameters:
        value - - The offset of the pulse-crossing sample in units of clock-cycles (4 ns intervals).

      • setReadoutWindow

        public void setReadoutWindow(int value)
        Sets the size of the readout window, in units of 4 ns samples.
        Parameters:
        value - - The readout window.

      • setReadoutWindowAfter

        public void setReadoutWindowAfter(double value)
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Set the time window after the trigger time in which this collection data should be written.
        Overrides:
        setReadoutWindowAfter in class ReadoutDriver
        Parameters:
        value - - The length of the readout window after the trigger time, in units of nanoseconds.

      • setReadoutWindowBefore

        public void setReadoutWindowBefore(double value)
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Set the time window before the trigger time in which this collection data should be written.
        Overrides:
        setReadoutWindowBefore in class ReadoutDriver
        Parameters:
        value - - The length of the readout window before the trigger time, in units of nanoseconds.

      • setTriggerPathTruthRelationsCollectionName

        public void setTriggerPathTruthRelationsCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the collection which contains the relations between truth hits from SLIC and the calorimeter hit output. This is specifically for the trigger path hits.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setTruthRelationsCollectionName

        public void setTruthRelationsCollectionName(String collection)
        Sets the name of the collection which contains the relations between truth hits from SLIC and the calorimeter hit output. This is specifically for the readout path hits.
        Parameters:
        collection - - The collection name.

      • setWriteTriggerPathTruth

        public void setWriteTriggerPathTruth(boolean state)
        Sets whether subdetector truth data for trigger path hits is to be produced or not.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the truth data should be created, and false that it should not.

      • setWriteTruth

        public void setWriteTruth(boolean state)
        Sets whether subdetector truth data for readout path hits is to be written to the output LCIO file or not.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the truth data should be written, and false that it should not.
